taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section tholiformes;species decor;

treatment.description: Grayish, doming to 6 dm. high; primocane with scattered subulate divergent prickles; primocane-leaves 3-foliolate or imperfectly 5-foliolate; the leaflets barely half as broad as long, gradually tapering or subcuneate at base; the terminal one on a petiolule nearly 2 cm. long, the lateral subsessile, soft-pubescent beneath; primocane-leaflets elliptic-oblong to narrowly obovate, acutish; corymb 4-6-flowered, the ascending pubescent pedicels up to 3 cm. long; calyx pilose; petals narrowly obovate, about 1.8 cm. long and 8-10 mm. broad.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Borders of dry woods, w. Ky.
